title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs. These programs provide full-time clinical nurse specialist education to registered nurses with the objective of producing qualified clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by authorizing programs that train nurses to provide care to patients with acute and chronic illnesses. It also defines nurse-managed health clinics as facilities managed by advanced practice nurses that offer primary care to underserved populations. Section 851(b)(1)(A)(iv) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include clinical nurse specialists along with nurse anesthetists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs includes amending various sections of the Public Health Service Act to update years from 2007 to 2021 and 2014 to 2021 for loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loan program, and comprehensive geriatric education. Funding for parts B, C, and section 831 is extended to 2021, with adjustments to include sections B and C. Nurse Education, Practice, Quality, and Retention Grants under Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act are amended to promote career advancement for various nursing personnel in different training settings and diverse population groups. This includes advancing individuals to become professional nurses, advanced education nurses, licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides. The Nurse Education, Practice, Quality, and Retention Grants under Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act are amended to promote career advancement for various nursing personnel, including developing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. The Nurse Education, Practice, Quality, and Retention Grants under Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act are amended to encourage mentoring, development of specialties, and include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
